snippet: While Twitter has suspended many users linked to the Islamic State, a study says at least 46,000 accounts publicize the group’s message of death.
abstract: Collaborative study of Brookings Institution and Google Ideas, and led by J M Berger, expert on online extremism, says Islamic State successfully spread its views through Twitter.

byline.original: By RICK GLADSTONE and VINDU GOEL
byline.contributor: Rick Gladstone reported from New York, and Vindu Goel from San Francisco. Scott Shane contributed reporting from Minneapolis.

lead_paragraph: While Twitter has suspended many users linked to the Islamic State, a study says at least 46,000 accounts publicize the group’s message of death.

headline.main: ISIS Is Adept on Twitter, Study Finds
headline.print_headline: Islamic State Is Adept on Twitter, Study Finds

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
